data.title: an event for the Guinness Book of Records [Archive]
data.meta_description:
I just found this curious announcement: 
 
EVENT 
"The Biggest Mandolin in the World in Heraklion" 
Cretan pentozali with more than 400 mandolins 
An event for the Guiness Book of Records 
Followed by a concert with renowned mandolin artists 
Organization and Direction: Michael Marakomichelakis 
 
This should happen on 13 July at the annual Heraklion Summer Festival.
data.text:
Plamen Ivanov

I just found this curious announcement:

EVENT

"The Biggest Mandolin in the World in Heraklion"

Cretan pentozali with more than 400 mandolins

An event for the Guiness Book of Records

Followed by a concert with renowned mandolin artists

Organization and Direction: Michael Marakomichelakis

This should happen on 13 July at the annual Heraklion Summer Festival (http://www.nowheraklion.com/festival.html).

Best,

Plamen

journeybear

Wow! I am not sure what they mean by the worlds largest mandolin - perhaps they meant the worlds largest assemblage of mandolins - but the Cretan pentozali (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pentozali) they mention is the typical dance from Crete, usually to music played on a bowed Cretan lyra (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretan_lyra)accompanied by a percussively played lute. I guess for this event the dancers will be accompanied by 400 mandolins. Should be quite the sight! Even though the Guinness Book of World Records has largely devolved into a tabulation of contrived carnival freak show stunts (here in America anyway), this is, um, noteworthy. :mandosmiley:
